p:
The lethality of α-bisabolol at lower concentrations (LC 50 and LC 95) for C. maculatus compared to that of V. arborea essential oil can be explained by its mechanism of action in the activation of K + ATP channels
14 . The biological activities of α-bisabolol include antibacterial
14 , scarring
25 , mutagenic/antimutagenic activity
13 , inhibition of mast cell granulation
26 , inhibition of the human P450 system
27 , and protection against gastric toxicity induced by acetylsalicylic acid
28 . The α-bisabolol at concentrations of 0.5 to 2 mM increased the permeability of the plasma membrane of Staphylococcus aureus and Escherichia coli
14 . α-Bisabolol antimicrobial activity seems to be related to the selective inhibition of ergosterol biosynthesis, antifungal in its pure form or the main component to develop antifungal drugs
29 .
